result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tao Vang

records.addlTxt: matter set for ptc 11/28/22 at 10:00
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Invoice filed by the Interpreter for Services on 09/19/22 
sent to Br 1 JA/Fiscal Clerk on 09/26/22 sp

11:18 AM Defendant Tao Vang in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Tao Vang.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge appears on behalf of ADA Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Lee Yang, appears via video.

ADA Dodge calls the case and states the appearances.
11:19 a.m.  Interpreter is sworn in.
This hearing is set today for a bond forfeiture.
Defendant failed to appear on 07/21/22 PreTrial Conference.
Atty Slattery set up a voluntary appearance on 08/15/22 and the defendant failed to appear.
Defendant was in custody on 09/08/22 and the Court increased his bond by $250.
State had then requested that the $1,000 cash bond be forfeited.
Defendant had been represented by the public defender and not his appointed counsel.
Interpreter had been set up for the 08/12/22 hearing date at a large expense to the county.
ADA Dodge is still seeking bond forfeiture.
Defendant missed his PreTrial Conference and then had been picked up on his warrant in Minnesota and then extradited back to Wisconsin.
ADA Dodge does indicate that the defendant had other warrants but may have taken care of them in the meantime.
ADA Dodge would motion the court to forfeit the bond previously posted.
Court questions Atty Slattery if he has additional information that he can provide to the court on his clients missed appearances.
Atty Slattery makes further statements with regards to the warrants.
Atty Slattery was unable to appear in person on 09/09/22 with his client as he had other obligations.
Atty Slattery did not expect to deal with the bond forfeiture today and had not had the opportunity to discuss this with his client without an interpreter being present.
Atty Slattery is not in a position to do the bond forfeiture today and would like this set for another date.
Atty Slattery states that his client resides in the State of Minnesota and would ask for either a ZOOM appearance for his client or that he be excused for the next PreTrial Conference.
Parties are to work and figure this out.

BY THE COURT: 
Court grants the adjournment of this hearing.
Defendant is to appear in Court for each hearing.
Court DENIES the request for forfeiture at this time but will review in the future if there are any missed future hearings.

11:28 a.m.  Case is adjourned.
Restitution Summary with Supporting Documents filed by the State

Confirmation that Interpreter will be appearing via ZOOM (ZOOM info emailed to him for Br 1 on 09/09/22 sp)
per the Judge's request

Invoice from Interpreter from Hearing held on 09/08/22 
sent to Br 1 JA and Fiscal Clerk

9/8/2022 : Cash bond amended from $1,000 to $1,250.
$1,000 has previously been posted. 

No contact with the addresses as stated on the record.

1:09 PM 
Defendant Tao Vang in court. Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Tao Vang. Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Lee Yang appears by zoom video for the defendant.
Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states appearances.
Matter set for a return on warrant.
Interpreter is sworn in by the clerk.
ADA Dodge makes statements and asks that the warrant be quashed.
ADA Dodge also asks that prior bond be forfeited.
Court questions Atty Bergner.
Atty Bergner notes he is appearing today only and that Atty Slattery is appointed to the case.

Court questions Atty Bergner as to the reason for missing Court. 
Atty Bergner responds.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant quashed.
Matter set for a pre-trial conference.
Defendant is required to appear in person.
Bond increased by $250 cash.
An interpreter will be needed for the next hearing. 

Court notes the reasons for the increase in cash bond.
Court questions the interpreter as to their availability. 

BY THE COURT:
Hearing time to be set for 11:00 AM to allow the interpreter to be able to appear.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

Atty Jambois states he will file the information with the amendments including the party to the crime information. 
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Court will allow the defendant not to be present at the pre-trial conference but he must be available by phone during that time.

3:32 PM Defendant Tao Vang in court.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Tao Vang. 

Interpreter Lee Yang is present in court and sworn by the clerk. 
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff. 

Atty Jambois indicates the complaint does not reflect that these charges are as party to the crime.  He will file an amended information showing party to the crime and that is how they will be proceeding today. 

Detective J. Klein is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Jambois. 
Exhibit #1 is referred to during testimony.

Atty Jambois moves for the admission of Exhibit #1 subject to cross examination. 
No objection by Atty Slattery. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #1 is received. 

Cross exam by Atty Slattery.

Atty Jambois makes arguments to the court. 
Atty Slattery makes arguments to the court. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Atty Jambois requests an arraignment and pretrial on a new date. 
Atty Slattery asks to do the arraignment today and not have his client appear at the pre-trial.
Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
01:39 PM Defendant Tao Vang in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Interpreter Lee Yang appears by video and sworn by the clerk. 

Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.  He will not understand it given the language. 
Court prints a copy of the complaint for the defendant. 
Atty Mutchler offers to read the complaint so the interpreter can interpret. 
Interpreter is willing to interpret the reading of the complaint. 
Atty Mutchler reads the complaint. 

Court questions the defendant regarding counsel. 
Defendant has been to the public defenders office.  He has the application. 
Court provides the petition to Atty Renc who is present in the courtroom.  
Atty Renc notes that he has a Petition for Appointment of Counsel because he was denied by the public defender. 
Atty Renc hands the petition back to the court. 
Court reviews the petition.  Court notes he has not provided the public defender information sheet with the petition. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant states there should be an evaluation sheet provided indicating why he was not qualified. 
Atty Renc states she is not sure that the defendant went to the public defenders office and questions the defendant. 
Court questions the defendant regarding his financials. 
Defendant responds to the court.  Questions his wife. 

BY THE COURT:  Court orders the matter set for an indigency hearing in Branch 2.

ADDRESS INFO for Tao Vang
Current: 1640 6th St E, Saint Paul, MN 55106   (Effective: 02-21-2022)
Prior: 1640 6Th St E, Saint Paul, MN 55106
Confirmation of Interpreter
Adjourned initial appearance on February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:23 PM Defendant Tao Vang in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Lee Yang, appears by video for the defendant.

Court questions the defendant if he has been provided with a copy of the complaint.
Defendant responds.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Defendant does not really understand the complaint
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Court goes over the charges/maximum penalties for this case 22CF28.
Court went over the charges/maximum penalties for 22CF25 which were incorrect.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant is informed that if he is not eligible for public defender representation then he can petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
Defendant wishes to be represented by an attorney.
ADA Cassidy provides the defendant with a copy of the complaint.
Address is confirmed to be correct.
Defendant has been provided with information to apply for a public defender and will need to make application with them.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Initial appearance is to be adjourned so defendant can make application with the public defender.
Defendant is to go to the public defender's office this afternoon to make application for representation.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for January 18, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2
No Agency #
No contact with the addresses as stated on the record

1:14 p.m.  Interepreter is sworn in. 
Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Theft of Major Part of a Motor Vehicle (Catalytic Converter Thefts) and Felony Bail Jumping.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation at this time.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the requested cash bond and would ask for a signature bond and states her reasons on the record.
Court adopts the requested cash bond of $1,000 with conditions as stated on the record.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  January 18, 2022 @  1:15 p.m.  in Branch 2
